intro: Tetrapterys poeppigiana var. glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular tetrapterys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, each bearing glandular hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to cream in color. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The glandular hairs on its leaves and stems are a notable botanical feature, contributing to its unique appearance and ecological interactions.
